content:
There are many excellent yoga apps that can guide you through a home practice. Here are some popular ones:

1. **Down Dog**: Offers a wide range of classes, customizable practices, and meditation sessions. (Free trial, then subscription-based)
2. **YogaGlo**: Features classes for all levels, with a focus on vinyasa flow, hatha, and restorative yoga. (Free trial, then subscription-based)
3. **Peloton Digital**: While known for their cycling classes, Peloton also offers a vast yoga library with classes ranging from beginner to advanced. (Free trial, then subscription-based)
4. **Yoga Studio**: A comprehensive app with classes, tutorials, and customizable practices. It also allows you to create your own sequences. (One-time purchase, no subscription)
5. **Asana Rebel**: Focuses on vinyasa flow and hatha yoga, with classes ranging from 10 to 60 minutes. (Free, with in-app purchases)
6. **Pocket Yoga**: A simple, easy-to-use app with a focus on hatha and vinyasa yoga. It also includes a pose dictionary and customizable practices. (One-time purchase, no subscription)
7. **Alo Moves**: Offers a variety of yoga styles, including vinyasa flow, hatha, and restorative yoga. (Free trial, then subscription-based)
8. **Calm**: While primarily a meditation app, Calm also features yoga classes and sleep stories. (Free trial, then subscription-based)
9. **Dylan Werner Yoga**: A unique app that focuses on dynamic, challenging flows and offers a variety of classes. (Free trial, then subscription-based)
10. **Yoga With Adriene**: A free app with a variety of classes, including vinyasa flow, hatha, and restorative yoga. (Free, with optional in-app purchases)

These apps are all available for both iOS and Android devices. You can try out a few to see which one resonates with you the most.

Remember, the most important thing is to find an app that motivates you to practice regularly and makes you feel comfortable and inspired in your home practice.
